text:
The administrative expenses
incurred by a contractor or subcontractor in connection with the administration
of a “bona fide” fringe benefit plan are not creditable towards the prevailing
wage under the Davis-Bacon Act. For example, a contractor would not be able to
take credit for the cost of an office employee who fills out medical insurance claim
forms for submission to an insurance carrier.
html: The administrative expenses incurred by a contractor or subcontractor in connection with the administration of a “bona fide” fringe benefit plan are not creditable towards the prevailing wage under the Davis-Bacon Act. For example, a contractor would not be able to take credit for the cost of an office employee who fills out medical insurance claim forms for submission to an insurance carrier.
